message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.CE, cs.LG 

The paper discusses a novel circuit for on-line learning in neuromorphic computing systems using memristive devices. The focus is on spike-based learning mechanisms that do not require overlapping pre- and post-synaptic pulses. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of memristive devices, which are electronic components that can change their resistance based on the history of applied voltages. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Emerging Technologies (cs.ET) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of a differential scheme based on the Gilbert normalizer circuit, which is a type of analog signal processing circuit. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Architecture (cs.AR) and Circuit Design (cs.CE) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the use of stochastic gradient descent learning rule in two benchmark classification tasks, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
